DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Do you often just... interject, as you put it?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can't someone else repair it?
RESPONSE TEXT: They were stolen from me in their prime. With a full two centuries left on their warranty.
The scavenger scum blasted them off me as I valiantly defended our ship systems. Were the ship's Surgeon still with us...
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll get right on it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Can't someone else repair it?
RESPONSE TEXT: Sadly, he is no longer with us. Another casualty in our thrice-cursed war with the scavengers. His passing is a terrible loss.
Look around. The Captain's vision brought us here - but it was the Surgeon who rebuilt the Constitution. Now it falls to us to carry on his work.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Bosun: Once you have resolved this matter, I beseech you to return to me to accept my undying gratitude.

RESPONSE TEXT: The ship's structural integrity is well below recommended levels, but pish posh, I'm certain everything will work out.
To play a part in something so magnificent, I am programmed to burst with excitement. Huzzah.
So much work to do. I'll have to factor in extra time for the lack of appendages.
'Tis an honor to crew such a storied vessel.
From the top deck one can spot other robots of the Commonwealth floating. Listless. Without purpose. But not us.
Huzzah for the Captain and the Constitution!
Continuing routine maintenance. It is a mere 73 days over due.
Everything is ship shape.
